text: The Minichinas Hills are a group of hills located in east central parkland region of Saskatchewan, Canada. The hills are covered with forests of poplar and willows; moreover, there are also some prairie and small lakes. There are many animals that live in and around these hills such as moose, elk, hawks, bald eagles, geese, ducks and lynx; cougars and black bears have also been spotted. These hills start from the south at Dana and stop to the north at St. Isidore-de-Bellevue which is a distance of about 100 kilometres. Category:Hills of Saskatchewan
title: Minichinas Hills
